fs.fibu2.filter
Class NameFilter

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.filter.NameFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntryFilter
public class NameFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntryFilter

This filters entries on comparing their 'name' value to a certain filter.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Constructor Summary
NameFilter()
          Creates a standard name filter, where Equality is the selected filter mode and the initial search string is the empty string

Constructor Detail

NameFilter

public NameFilter()
Creates a standard name filter, where Equality is the selected filter mode and the initial search string is the empty string

NameFilter

public NameFilter(StandardFilterComponent.Selection typeOfFilter,
                  java.lang.String filter)
Constructs a name filter for either regex or equality filtering

Parameters:
typeOfFilter - Either REGEX or EQUALITY
filter - The associated filter string
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If typeOfFilter == RANGE
java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - - If REGEX is the type of filter and the filter string is not a valid regular expression

NameFilter

public NameFilter(java.lang.String min,
                  java.lang.String max)
Constructs a range filter

Parameters:
min - the minimum value. Empty, if null is passed
max - the maximal value. Empty, if null is passed

NameFilter

public NameFilter(StandardFilterComponent.Selection typeOfFilter,
                  java.lang.String firstFilter,
                  java.lang.String secondFilter)
           throws java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException
Creates a name filter

Parameters:
typeOfFilter - Whether this filter checks for string equality, matching of a regular expression or alphabetical range. If null, EQUALITY is selected.
firstFilter - The filter used for equality or pattern matching or as minimal value. null is interpreted as the empty string or as minus infinity for range filtering
secondFilter - The filter used as maximal value for range comparison. A null string means plus infinity
Throws:
java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - - If REGEX is the type of filter and the first filter is not a valid regular expression

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Specified by:
getDescription in interface EntryFilter
Returns:
An exact description of this filter, e.g. 'Date range filter between 1.1.2009 and 23.4.2010'

getEditor

public EntryFilterEditor getEditor(Journal j)
Specified by:
getEditor in interface EntryFilter
Parameters:
j - The editor might need data about the journal in which it filters (e.g. a list of available categories).
Returns:
An editor for the filter. If the filter should not be editable, this should return null. The editor component should already be filled with the data of the current configuration.

Specified by:

verifyEntry

public boolean verifyEntry(Entry e)
Verifies the entry according to the given parameters

Specified by:
verifyEntry in interface EntryFilter
Returns:
Whether e fulfills the criteria of this filter. The null entry should verify no criterion at all.

createMeFromPreferences

public EntryFilter createMeFromPreferences(java.util.prefs.Preferences filterNode)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: EntryFilter
Creates a new filter from the given Preferences object, which (supposedly) has been created by calling the method EntryFilterEntryFilter.insertMyPreferences(Preferences) before.

Specified by:
createMeFromPreferences in interface EntryFilter
Parameters:
filterNode - This should be the node of name filter which was inserted by the EntryFilterEntryFilter.insertMyPreferences(Preferences) method.
Returns:
An entry filter conforming to the given preferences.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the given node is null or does not contain a valid configuration

insertMyPreferences

public void insertMyPreferences(java.util.prefs.Preferences node)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Description copied from interface: EntryFilter
Inserts this filter's configuration into the given node. The format should always be as follows:
- A node with name 'filter' should be inserted in node. All further nodes are inserted within this node
- In its map, this node should have an entry with key 'id' and value as returned by EntryFilterEntryFilter.getID(). This is necessary to be able to create filters from their preference nodes

Specified by:
insertMyPreferences in interface EntryFilter
Parameters:
node - The node under which this filter's configuration should be inserted
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - If node == null
